content.question: Objects in a system can be in two possible states: state <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> and state <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>. The vector <math alttext="vector v equals a 2 by 1 vector where row 1 is 0.3 and row 2 is 0.7"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>0.3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>0.7</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math> gives the probability that an object is in each state. If matrix <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is the transition matrix for these states and <math alttext="A times vector v equals vector v"><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, which of the following can be concluded?

choices.label: Because the vector is not <math alttext="a 2 by 1 vector where row 1 is 0.5 and row 2 is 0.5"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, the system will not reach a steady state.

Because the vector is not <math alttext="a 2 by 1 vector where row 1 is 0.5 and row 2 is 0.5"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, there must be more steps to find the steady state.
Because the vector remains unchanged, the transition matrix must be the identity matrix.

Because the vector remains unchanged, in the long run, the system has about <math alttext="30 percent sign"><mn>30</mn><mo>%</mo></math> in one state and <math alttext="70 percent sign"><mn>70</mn><mo>%</mo></math> in the other state.

content.answer: Because the vector remains unchanged, in the long run, the system has about <math alttext="30 percent sign"><mn>30</mn><mo>%</mo></math> in one state and <math alttext="70 percent sign"><mn>70</mn><mo>%</mo></math> in the other state.
